intro: Tawaia sabahensis, commonly known as the Bornean tawaia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are yellowish-green with a distinctive scent, attracting specific pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
